sage.terrain

Class HillHeightMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.terrain.AbstractHeightMap
      • sage.terrain.HillHeightMap

  • public class HillHeightMap
extends AbstractHeightMap
    HillHeightMap generates a height map based on the Hill Raising Algorithm. Terrain is generated by growing hills of random edgeSize and height at random points in the heightmap. The terrain is then normalized and valleys can be flattened.
    Author:
    Frederik Bï¿½lthoff, in JMonkeyEngine.
    See Also:
    Hill Raising Algorithm

    • Constructor Detail

      • HillHeightMap

        public HillHeightMap(int size,
                     int iterations,
                     float minRadius,
                     float maxRadius,
                     byte flattening,
                     long seed)
        Constructor sets the attributes of the hill system and generates the height map using the specified random number generator seed.
        Parameters:
        size - the edgeSize of the terrain to be generated
        iterations - the number of hills to grow
        minRadius - the minimum radius of a hill
        maxRadius - the maximum radius of a hill
        flattening - the power of flattening done, 1 means none; must be >= 1
        seed - the random number generator seed; allows generating the same heightmap again
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if edgeSize of the terrain is not greater than zero, or number of iterations is not greater than zero, or minRadius or maxRadius is not greater than zero, or minRadius is not less than maxRadius, or flattening is less than 1.

      • HillHeightMap

        public HillHeightMap(int size,
                     int iterations,
                     float minRadius,
                     float maxRadius,
                     byte flattening)
        Constructor sets the attributes of the hill system and generates the height map by using a random seed.
        Parameters:
        size - edgeSize the edgeSize of the terrain to be generated
        iterations - the number of hills to grow
        minRadius - the minimum radius of a hill
        maxRadius - the maximum radius of a hill
        flattening - the power of flattening done, 1 means none
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if any of the conditions listed in constructor HillHeightMap(int, int, float, float, byte, long) are violated.

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public boolean load()
        Generates a heightmap using the Hill Raising Algorithm and the attributes set by the constructor or the setters.
        Specified by:
        load in class AbstractHeightMap
        Returns:
        true if the load was successful, false otherwise.

      • addHill

        protected void addHill(float[][] tempBuffer,
                       java.util.Random random)
        Generates a new hill of random edgeSize and height at a random position in the heightmap. This is the actual Hill algorithm. The Random object is used to guarantee the same heightmap given the same seed and attributes.
        Parameters:
        tempBuffer - the temporary height map buffer
        random - the random number generator

      • normalize

        protected void normalize(float[][] tempBuffer)
        Normalizes the heightmap values so they are between 0.0 and 1.0. This is necessary for the flatten algorithm to work properly.
        Parameters:
        tempBuffer - the temporary heightmap buffer

      • flatten

        protected void flatten(float[][] tempBuffer)
        Flattens out valleys in the heightmap. The flattening algorithm makes the valleys more prominent while keeping the hills mostly intact. Flattening works by repeatedly multiplying the current heightmap values by themselves a number of times specified by the current flattening parameter. Since heightmap values are first normalize to the range (0..1), this causes values which are close to zero (low points) to reduce rapidly while values closer to 1 (high points) tend to remain larger.
        Parameters:
        tempBuffer - the buffer containing the heightmap values to be flattened
        See Also:
        setFlattening(byte)

      • setIterations

        public void setIterations(int iterations)
        Sets the number of hills to grow. More hills usually mean a nicer heightmap.
        Parameters:
        iterations - the number of hills to grow
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if iterations if not greater than zero

      • setFlattening

        public void setFlattening(byte flattening)
        Sets the amount of flattening done in the algorithm. Flattening makes the valleys more prominent while leaving the hills mostly untouched.
        Parameters:
        flattening - the power of flattening, one means none
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if flattening is less than one

      • setMaxRadius

        public void setMaxRadius(float maxRadius)
        Sets the maximum radius of an individual hill.
        Parameters:
        maxRadius - the maximum radius of any hill
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the maximum radius if not greater than zero or not greater than the minimum radius

      • setMinRadius

        public void setMinRadius(float minRadius)
        Sets the minimum radius of an individual hill.
        Parameters:
        minRadius - the minimum radius of any hill
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the minimum radius is not greater than zero or not less than the maximum radius
